revised_title: Observations on the Measurement of Three Degrees of the Meridian: A Comparative Analysis
tldr: The author, Don Joseph Rodriguez, analyzes the measurements of three degrees of the meridian conducted in England by Lieut.-Col. William Mudge. He compares the results with other measurements from Lapland, Bengal, and France, and suggests that the discrepancies may be due to errors in astronomical observations rather than local attractions.
